top_comments_top.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.
It’s fine. Never once cut any of my three kids.
My grandmother taught us to bite them off.
My baby’s nails were super soft, and when I tried filing it took way too long or it didn’t work.
Bad tip. Don't worry new parents, bite them or clip them. You'll instinctively be gentle. Don't file them. The nails are soft.

top_comments_best.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.
It’s fine. Never once cut any of my three kids.
My baby’s nails were super soft, and when I tried filing it took way too long or it didn’t work.
We were told the same thing but those suckers get LOOONG so fast. We had to clip them and haven't cut our infant accidentally with the clippers yet.
Bad tip. Don't worry new parents, bite them or clip them. You'll instinctively be gentle. Don't file them. The nails are soft.
